Posts.Title: Stage 3 breast cancer help & how to tell my children

Posts.Content: Thankyou so much for taking the time to message me I hope your doing ok. I told my children yesterday and they were amazing, my 10 year old boy doesn't wana talk about it again tho!!! I've just said as, when if he's ready he can. I have my opp to remove the breast on the 12th so feeling very worried and scared the nearer it gets.   Once again Thankyou so much xx
Posts.Title: Stage 3 breast cancer help & how to tell my children

Posts.Content: Thankyou so much Lucy for taking time to reply to me. Yes your right I feel like I'm on a rollacosta at the min 1 day I'm ok then the next I'm in bits. My kids were told tests at and they were amazing. I know I have a long road ahead of me but just talking 1 day at a time. My operation is the 12thsept so feeling very upset that my boob will be taken away but what's a boob when it come to your life ( that's what I keep telling myself )  Pleased you have come out the other side.  Take care  Sarah xxxxx
Posts.Title: Stage 3 breast cancer help & how to tell my children

Posts.Content: Thankyou so much Helen, your message has made me feel so much better. The waiting game and the Unknown is dreadful. The feeling in my stomach just won't leave and the waves of emotion are so up and down.  Thankyou for everyone's messages, not quite sure what I'm doing on this sight at the mo but all ready the messages are making me feel so much better.  Sarah xx

Stage 3 breast cancer help & how to tell my children

Posts.Content: Thankyou so much for taking the time to reply to me xx
Posts.Title: Stage 3 breast cancer help & how to tell my children

Posts.Content: Thankyou so much for your reply, when I'm feeling more stronger I will reply properly xxx
Posts.Title: Stage 3 breast cancer help & how to tell my children

Posts.Content: My name is Sarah i am 41, I have just been diagnosed with stage 3 breast cancer, I am having the breast removed in two weeks. I am in pieces as I don't know what to expect and looking for some guidance and support. I have 3 children under 10 and would also like some guidance to how to approach telling them. I would really appreciate if someone can help who's going through or has been through this. Thank you Sarah X
Posts.Title: Stage 3 breast cancer help & how to tell my children
Stage 3 breast cancer help & how to tell my children

Posts.Content: Thankyou and I'm sure everything will be fine, stay strong and fight with me xxx
Posts.Title: Stage 3 breast cancer help & how to tell my children

Posts.Content: Thankyou so much for your reply xxx
